item.title: Guides
item.content:encoded:
Guides

  • Page Config

  • Markdown Enhance

  • Function Disable

  • Encryption Demo

item.title: Component disabled
item.description: <p>You can disable some functions on the page by setting the Frontmatter of the page.</p>
item.content:encoded:
You can disable some functions on the page by setting the Frontmatter of the page.

These should be disabled on this page:

  • Navbar
  • Sidebar
  • Breadcrumb
  • Page information
  • Contributors
  • Edit link
  • Update time
  • Prev/Next link
  • Comment
  • Footer
  • Back to top button

item.title: Markdown Enhance
item.description: <p><code>vuepress-theme-hope</code> enables more syntax in Markdown via the built-in <a href="https://vuepress-theme-hope.github.io/md-enhance" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">md-enhance</a> plugin.</p>
item.content:encoded:
vuepress-theme-hope enables more syntax in Markdown via the built-in md-enhance plugin.

Enable all

You can set themeconfig.mdEnhance.enableAll to enable all features of the md-enhance plugin.



 
 
 



module.exports = {
  themeConfig: {
    mdEnhance: {
      enableAll: true,
    },
  },
};
1
2
3
4
5
6
7

New Feature

Superscript and Subscript

19th H2O

Code 
19^th^ H~2~O

}

item.title: page config
item.content:encoded:
Page information

You can set page information in Markdownâ€™s Frontmatter.

  • The author is set to Ms.Hope.

  • The writing time should be January 1, 2020

  • Category is "Guide"

  • Tags are "Page Config" and "Guide"

Page content

You are free to write your Markdown here.

Tips

  • Please use the relative link ./ for pictures in the Markdown folder.

  • For pictures in .vuepress/public folder, please use absolute link / for reference

The theme contains a custom badge:

A dark blue badge text badge at the end of line. Not supported content

Page structure

This page should contain:

  • Back to top button
  • Route navigation
  • Comments
  • Footer

item.title: Project home
item.content:encoded:
This is an example of a normal homepage. You can place your main content here.

To use this layout, you need to set home: true in the page front matter.

For related descriptions of configuration items, please see Project HomePage Layout Config.

item.title: Intro Page
item.content:encoded:
Intro Page

Place your introducation and profile here.

item.title: Custom Layout
item.content:encoded:
You can use slots with markdown and component support to custom page layout.

Note

This is just a demo, you should add styles according to your own needs.

For details, see Custom layout.

item.title: Blog Home
item.content:encoded:
This is a blog home page.

To use this layout, you should set both blog: true and home: true in the page front matter.

For related configuration docs, please see blog homepage

item.title: Slide page
item.content:encoded: Not supported content

item.title: Opensslä¸€é”®è‡ªç­¾è¯ä¹¦
item.content:encoded:
Opensslä¸€é”®è‡ªç­¾è¯ä¹¦

vim openssl.sh

#!/bin/bash
while [[ -z "$domain" ]];do
    read -p "è¾“å…¥åŸŸå/IP(å¿…å¡«,å¦‚ *.haoduck.com): " domain
done
read -p "è¾“å…¥é‚®ç®±(é€‰å¡«,é»˜è®¤admin@haoduck.com): " mail
[[ -z "$mail" ]] && mail=admin@haoduck.com
read -p "è¾“å…¥æ—¥æœŸ(é€‰å¡«,é»˜è®¤3650): " day
[[ -z "$day" ]] && day=3650
dir=$domain && mkdir -p $dir
crt_file="$dir/${domain}.crt"
key_file="$dir/${domain}.key"
if [[ "$(command -v openssl)" ]];then
    openssl req -x509 -nodes -newkey rsa:2048 -days $day -keyout $key_file -out $crt_file -subj "/C=US/ST=California/L=Los Angeles/O=Haoduck/OU=Aoao/CN=${domain}/emailAddress=${mail}"
    echo -e "\tè¯ä¹¦ï¼š$(pwd)/$crt_file\n\tç§é’¥ï¼š$(pwd)/$key_file"
else
    echo "openssl æœªå®‰è£…"
fi
